intro: Phelipanche bungeana, commonly known as the common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in the early morning, hence its common name. The plant is native to regions of Asia, including China and Japan, and thrives in temperate climates. Its vines can grow up to several meters long, and it has heart-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. The plant is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive flowers and vigorous growth habit.
